p: Methyl 2-isothiocyanatobenzoate 1 (0.193 g, 0.001 mol) was allowed to react with L-norephedrine (2-amino-1-phenylpropan-1-ol) (0.151 g, 0.001 mol) 2 in NMR tube in CDCl 3 and measured immediately for 1H and 13 C NMR to give 3. When the reaction was carried out in the presence of chloroform containing a catalytic amount of triethylamine the reaction gave 4 instead of 3 at room temperature. The product 4 was crystallized from ethanol. Derivative 3 was rapidly converted to 4 at room temperature.
